conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and needs to be predicted which container (D, E, or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Point A is at the top left, point B is in the middle, and point C is at the top right. Containers D, E, and F are at the bottom, colored purple, red, and green respectively.
There are baffles of different colors: black, purple, cyan, and yellow, positioned diagonally within the image.
Liquid from point A flows downward and encounters the black baffle, which diverts the flow to the left.
After being diverted to the left by the black baffle, the liquid from point A continues downward until it reaches container D.
Liquid from point B flows downward and encounters the purple baffle.
The liquid from point B does not interact with any other baffles and continues downward until it reaches container E.
Liquid from point C flows downward and encounters the cyan baffle, which diverts the flow to the right.
After being diverted to the right by the cyan baffle, the liquid from point C continues downward until it reaches container F.
Liquid from A flows into container D, liquid from B flows into container E, and liquid from C flows into container F.
